description: A multi-period settlement site lasting from the 1st CE to the early 5th CE. Unusual for it's sunken-feature buildings which have more in common with continental architectural styles than British, a small rectangular building at the western fringe of the site is interpreted as a road-side shrine.
bibliography: Bennett, Clark, Hicks, Rady, and Riddler. “At the Great Crossroads: Prehistoric, Roman and Medieval Discoveries on the Isle of Thanet 1994-95.” Canterbury Archaeological Trust Occasional Paper No.4 (2008).
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Monkton (Kent).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
